details.title: IPL Player Auction 2021 is all set to begin!
details.content:
The IPL Player Auction 2021 will begin at 3 pm and will be held in Chennai. This year will have a mini-auction and has let the franchises retain any number of players. And a total of 164 Indian players, 124 overseas players and 3 players from Associate Nations will be up for grabs.

The live telecast of the same will be broadcast on Star Sports 1 and Disney+ Hotstar.

details.title: Top draw Mark Wood pulls out of IPL 2021 auction
details.content:
INR 2 crore is the highest reserve price and Wood was among the eight overseas players, who chose to be slotted in the highest bracket.

Franchises were informed at a briefing in Chennai on Wednesday that the pacer had decided to pull out of the auction in order to spend time with his family at home. (READ MORE)

details.content:

details.title: Here's the team status of all 8 franchises
details.content:
Chennai Super Kings: Available purse: Rs 19.90 crore | Slots left: 6

Delhi Capitals: Available purse: Rs 13.40 crore | Slots left: 8

Punjab Kings: Available purse: Rs 53.30 crore | Slots left: 9

Kolkata Knight Riders: Available purse: Rs 10.75 crore | Slots left: 8

Mumbai Indians: Available purse: Rs 15.35 crore | Slots left: 7

Royal Challengers Bangalore: Available purse: Rs 35.40 crore | Slots left: 11

Rajasthan Royals: Available purse: Rs 37.85 crore | Slots left: 9

Sunrisers Hyderabad: Available purse: Rs 10.75 crore | Slots left: 3

details.title: Auctioneer for the day is Hugh Edmeades!
details.content: He is a British international fine art, classic car and charity auctioneer. Conducted the auction of 88 guitars belonging to Eric Clapton raising a total of $7,438,624. Has also auctioneered Daniel Craig's Aston Martin DB10 from James Bond's Spectre, which sold for £2,434,500 in 2016.

details.title: The Capitals have their way with Smith!
details.content: Australia's Steve Smith bought by Ricky Ponting coached Delhi Capitals for Rs 2.20 crore.

details.title: Vihari, Roy, Hales unsold
details.content:
Jason Roy

Karun Nair

Evin Lewis

Alex Hales

Aaron Finch

Hanuma Vihari

details.title: And the bidding war begins for Maxwell!

details.content: The bidding has crossed the Rs 10-crore mark!

details.title: RCB make record signing with Glenn Maxwell for Rs 14.25 crore
details.content: Glenn Maxwell might just be the most expensive player of this auction as he ties up with fifth expensive signing of all time till now - after Yuvraj Singh Rs 16 crore (SunRisers Hyderabad), Pat Cummins Rs 15.5 crore (Kolkata Knight Riders), Gautam Gambhir Rs 14.9 crore (Kolkata Knight Riders) and Ben Stokes Rs 14.5 crore (Rising Pune Supergiant).

details.title: And now Shakib Al Hasan goes under the hammer!
KKR welcome back the Bangladeshi all-rounder!
details.content:
KKR welcome back the Bangladeshi all-rounder by spending Rs 3.2 crore.

????? ????? ??????! #IPLAuction #IPL2021

— KolkataKnightRiders (@KKRiders) February 18, 2021

details.title: Chennai Super Kings make their first buy with Moeen Ali!
details.content: Moeen Ali is raising the heat now. CSK, PBKs go against each other but Chennai manages to get the England all-rounder for Rs 7 crore.
Kedar Jadhav goes unsold!

details.title: All-rounder Shivam Dube sold to Rajasthan Royals for Rs 4.4 crore.
Chris Morris raising the heat!
details.content: Chris Morris raising the heat as bids cross Rs 10 crore mark!

details.title: Chris Morris becomes most expensive player of all time
details.content: The 33-year-old South African all-rounder Chris Morris has become the most expensive player ever bought at an IPL auction. In a truly 'Royals' bid, Rajasthan snapped him up for Rs 16.25 crore.

details.title: Mad bidding for Morris!
details.content: The bidding war for Chris Morris topped the trade record of SunRisers Hyderabad which bought Yuvraj Singh for Rs 16 crores.

details.title: Chris Morris, Glenn Maxwell enter the IPL history books
details.content:
The top six expensive signings of IPL: 

  • Chris Morris Rs 16.25 crore (Rajasthan Royals)
  • Yuvraj Singh Rs 16 crore (SunRisers Hyderabad)
  • Pat Cummins Rs 15.5 crore (Kolkata Knight Riders)
  • Gautam Gambhir Rs 14.9 crore (Kolkata Knight Riders)
  • Ben Stokes Rs 14.5 crore (Rising Pune Supergiant).
  • Glenn Maxwell Rs 14.25 crore (Royal Challengers Bangalore)

details.title: Dawid Malan sold for Rs 1.5 crore!
details.content: England batsman Dawid Malan sold for Rs 1.5 crore to Punjab Kings.

details.content: Everyone tried their hand for the young pacer as bids Rs 8 crore!

details.title: Joy for Jhye!
details.content: Australian pacer Jhye Richardson sold to Punjab Kings for Rs 14 crore!

details.title: Mumbai Indians take back pacer Nathan Coulter-Nile for Rs 5 crore!

details.content: Indian pacer Umesh Yadav bought by Delhi Capitals for Rs 1 crore.
Harbhajan Singh goes unsold!
Piyush Chawla sold to Mumbai Indians for Rs 2.4 crore

details.title: Uncapped young boys enter the bidding fray!
details.content:
Sachin Baby,  Himmat Singh, Rajat Patidar sold to RCB for Rs 20 lakh.

Ripal Patel sold to DC for Rs 20 Lakh.

details.content: All-rounder Krishnappa Gowtham sold to Chennai Super Kings for Rs 9.25 crore.
Australian pacer Riley Meredith sold Punjab Kings for Rs 8 crore!

details.title: Its a day of surprises for CSK fans!
details.content: Pujara sold to CSK for Rs 50 lakh.

details.title: Kyle Jamieson breaks record, sold for Rs 15 crore!
details.content: Royal Challenger Bangalore means business here, splurge Rs 15 crore for the New Zealander. Jamieson becomes the fourth most expensive player in the tournament history.

details.title: Break before accelerated auction!
details.content: A 45 break is taken and when the auction resumes teams will submit a list of players of their interest and they will be auctioned.

Jimmy Neesham goes for Rs 50 Lakh to Mumbai Indians

details.title: Auction highlights!
details.content: South African Chris Morris led the pack with a record Rs 16.25 crore bid from Rajasthan Royals as all-rounders and foreign fast bowlers walked away with bank-breaking deals in the 2021 IPL auction. Check out the cricketers and the clubs they were bagged by this year.

details.content: CSK, DC, PK and SRH hit the 25-player limit maximum.

details.title: All players bought: RCB
details.content: Kyle Jamieson (15 crore), Glenn Maxwell (14.25 crore), Dan Christian (4.8 crore), Sachin Baby (20 lakh), Rajat Patidar (20 lakh), Mohammed Azharuddeen (20 lakh), Suyash Prabhudesai (20 lakh), KS Bharat (20 lakh)

details.title: All players bought: CSK
details.content: K Gowtham (9.25 crore), Moeen Ali (7 crore), Cheteshwar Pujara (50 lakh), K Bhagath Varma (20 lakh), C Hari Nishaanth (20 lakh), M Harisankar Reddy (20 lakh)

details.title: All players bought: Mumbai Indians
details.content: Nathan Coulter Nile (5 crore), Adam Milne (3.2 crore), Piyush Chawla (2.4 crore), James Neesham (50 lakh), Yudhvir Charak (20 lakh), Marco Jansen (20 lakh), Arjun Tendulkar (20 lakh)
